alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 9:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, Ewing, Tullytown, White Horse, Mercerville-Hamilton Square, Edinburg, Levittown, Morrisville, Yardville- Groveville, and Fairless Hills. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 59 and 68. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
